citations.narrative:
On March 9, 2025, the licensee transported a ring-tailed lemur from site 006 and a ferret from site 001 to the Attending
Veterinarian. After consultation with the Attending Veterinarian both animals did not return to their respective sites.
Instead, both animals were kept at a location not approved for housing animals under the current license from March 9
through March 11, 2025.
A license is issued to specific persons and for approved sites. The licensee shall notify Animal Care no fewer than 90
days prior to a substantial change in business, which includes any change in address, locations, name/business
ownership changes, activities, and number or type of animals described in 2.1(b)(2). Keeping Animal Care informed as to
the location of the covered animals allows for the required unannounced inspections to ensure compliance with the
Animal Welfare Act.
A licensee shall notify Animal Care no fewer than 90 days and obtain a new license before any change in the name,
address, management, substantial control or ownership of his business or operation, locations, activities, and number or
type of animals described in paragraph (b)(2) of this section.
Correct by: April 10, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
